contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio Station | name = XHTY-FM | image = [[Image:XHTY-FM.png|175px]]| city = [[Tijuana, Baja California]]| area = [[Tijuana, Baja California]]<br>[[San Diego, California]]| branding = La Invasora| slogan = | airdate = 1979| frequency = 99.7 ([[Megahertz|MHz]]) | format = [[Regional Mexican]] | erp = 30,000 [[Watt]]s | haat = 324 meters| class = [[List of broadcast station classes|C1]]| former_callsigns =| sister_stations = [[XHFG-FM|XHFG]], [[XHA-FM]], [[XEMO-AM|XEMO]], [[XERCN-AM|XERCN]] | owner =Uniradio<br>''(license and transmitter owned by a Mexican company)''| website = [http://www.uniradio.com/UniradioSpanish/htm/Estaciones/URStationsXHTY.html La Invasora 99.7] | callsign_meaning = | }} '''XHTY-FM''' is a commercial [[radio station]] located in [[Tijuana, Baja California]], broadcasting to the [[Tijuana, Baja California]] and [[San Diego, California]] area on 99.7 [[FM Broadcasting|FM]]. '''XHTY-FM''' airs a [[regional Mexican]] music format branded as "La Invasora" which in English translates to "The Invader." '''XHTY''' is programmed from [[San Diego, California]] by Uniradio, with its license and transmitter owned by a Mexican company. ==External links== *[http://www.uniradio.com/UniradioSpanish/htm/Estaciones/URStationsXHTY.html Official Website] {{Tijuana Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Radio stations in Tijuana]] [[Category:Regional Mexican radio stations]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
